definition: diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: This catalogue includes a foreword by Christophe W. Mao and essay by John Tancock.
sentences.chinese: 圖錄包括茅爲清的前言及唐冠科撰寫的文章。

sentences.english: This catalog contains a foreword by Christophe Mao and essays by Professor Zheng Shengtian and Professor Bai Qianshen.
sentences.chinese: 圖錄包括茅爲清的前言及鄭勝天和白謙慎撰寫的文章。

sentences.english: This catalogue documents Open My Door, the new series of paintings by the Zhou Brothers.
sentences.chinese: 本圖錄介紹了周氏兄弟新的繪畫系列《打開我門》。

sentences.english: This catalogue contains a foreword by Christophe Mao and an essay by Zheng Shengtian.
sentences.chinese: 圖錄包括茅爲清的前言及鄭勝天撰寫的文章。

sentences.english: The catalogue is divided into three mini-books.
sentences.chinese: 這本圖錄分成三個袖珍型的書。

sentences.english: The catalogue contains a foreword by Christophe Mao and essay by Feng Boyi.
sentences.chinese: 圖錄包括茅爲清的前言及馮博一撰寫的文章。

sentences.english: Long-term focus on the hardcover collection auction catalog design and printing.
sentences.chinese: 長期專注於收藏品拍賣精裝圖錄的設計與印刷。

definition: to record/to put down in writing
to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
printing plate bearing an image (illustration, photo etc)/print made with such a plate
specific topic (addressed by a book, lecture, TV program etc)/article, report or program etc on a specific topic
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
to auction/auction sale/to sell at a reduced price
Palace Museum, in the Forbidden City, Beijing/National Palace Museum, Taipei
